comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In 1914, Hamilton Wright Mabie (1846-1916) wrote a seven-page booklet report [available online] for the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, titled: "Educational Exchange with Japan -- A Report on Observations Made in 1912-1913." Mabie also published a book in 1914, called "Japan Today and Tomorrow." [This also may be read online.]

comment.author: 66311327@N05
66311327@N05
comment._content: LOC note misspelling: Soyeda, not Soveda "Juichi Soyeda (添田 壽一 Soeda Juichi?, September 15, 1864 – July 4, 1929) was a Japanese lawyer, senior civil servant and academic economist." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juichi_Soyeda In 1913, he visited the United States as representative of the Tokyo Chamber of Commerce, in connection with the California Alien Land Law of 1913 together with Tadao Kamiya.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Russell: Lindsay Russell, President of the Japan Society since 1910, see www.japansociety.org/resources/content/9/7/8/documents/Ce..., page 17

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: LOC note misspelling: Kamiya, not Kamita Tadao Kamiya, chief secretary of the chamber of commerce of Tokio in 1913, see The Ogden standard., June 20, 1913, 4 o'clock p.m. City Edition, Page 10, 4th column, "WILSON RECEIVES JAPANESE PARTY".

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: LOC note misspelling: Okazaki, not Okazari Kiujiro Okazaki, a member of the Japanese Parliament, came to the USA in June 1913, see u.o. New-York tribune., June 24, 1913, Page 2, with photo The Salt Lake tribune., June 23, 1913, Page 5, 4th. column, "RIDICULES IDEA OF JAPAN'S FIGHTING US"

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Ichinomiya: Reitaro Ichinomiya, assistant of the General Manager K. Imanishi of the Yokohama Specie Bank in New York in 1908, see www.archive.org/stream/japaninnewyork01anra/japaninnewyor.... He is still in the same bank in 1915, see query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F50817F93A5C13...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for all of your hard work identifying these people, B-59.  We will definitely add some of the information to the record when we update. Have you any thoughts about why all of these men would be sitting together?  The date seems to be sometime in June 1913.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: I found at last an article in The New York Times, June 27, 1913 which says there was a luncheon, given by the Japan Society of New York at the Hotel Astor on June 26, 1913. The meeting was about the situation of the Japanese in Calfornia (see en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California_Alien_Land_Law_of_1913). All persons in the photo above are mentionned in the article, plus several others. Russel is obviously not - as I supposed first because of a certain similarity - Bertrand Russel, but Lindsay Russel, the President of the Japan Society.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks so much for your perseverance, B-59. This information will add a good deal to the record.  We will add some of it the next time we update.
